H0.text: when did equus first appear in fossil record. 4 million years ago

H1.text: when did equus first appear in fossil record. 50 million years ago

H2.text: when did equus first appear in fossil record. 2.5 million years ago

H3.text: when did equus first appear in fossil record. 1820s

A4.text: The genus originated in North America and dispersed into the Old World and South America during the Early and Middle Pleistocene.

A5.text: Molecular dating indicates the caballoid lineage diverged from the noncaballoids 4 Mya.

A6.text: The oldest fossil to date is ~3.5 million years old, discovered in Idaho.

A7.text: The first Old World equid fossil was found in the gypsum quarries in Montmartre, Paris, in the 1820s.
